labels.name: P2: Fix can wait a while

data.system_settings: iPhone 8 on iOS 11.2.2 & MacBook Pro (late 2013) on MacOS 10.12.1
data.actual_result: The call verifies and then connects to the user on the other end even though you have blocked them.
data.expected_result: The call should fail because you have them blocked and they are no longer technically on your friends list.
data.short_description: Blocking a user still allows you to properly interact with them via Voice & Video calls.
data.steps_to_repro: - iOS: Block a user. - Press the three dots or press and hold on their name to bring up the user settings menu. - Press "Start Voice Call" or "Start Video Call". - The call popup will appear and the blocked user will receive the "x started a call" and will be able to join the call. - Pressing "Redail" before the person joins will physically ring the blocked user. - Desktop: Block a user. - Click "Start Voice Call". - The blocked user will receive a system notification that x started a call (if enabled). - The call will not ring at all but will allow you to click "Join Call" and fully interact with them.
